default: (a) One {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} (and a quiver with 20 ammunitions is needed) or (b) a quarterstaff
(a) Two {@filter simple weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} or (b) a {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} and a {@item shield|phb}.
(a) A {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

armor.full: shields (warde will not wear armor or use shields made of metal)

default: (a) {@item scalemail| phb} (non metal subclasses) or (b) {@item Leather armor|phb}
(a) Two {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} with (and a quiver with 20 ammunitions is needed)
(a) Two {@filter simple weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} or (b) a {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} and a {@item shield|phb}.
(a) A {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

spell.name: Acid Hydra

components.m: a vial of stomach acid from a poisonous creature

entries: You create 4 hydra heads made of acid. Every head jumps to a 5 ft. radius centered in point inside the spell range.

For each head, creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 5d10} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Objects in the area start to melt getting 2 points of permanent and cumulative damage per head.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you create one additional head.

spell.name: Bashing Shield
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack, against one creature within the spell's range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target gets the attack normal damage and the creature is marked by you for one round. If the marked creature attacks another creature than yourself within the duration of the spell and it is inside your melee range you automatically bash it with your shield doing force damage equal to your spellcasting modifier ending the effect of the spell.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} force damage to the target, and the shield force damage increases to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d8} at 11th level and 17th level.

spell.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: You can briefly control elemental forces nearby, causing one of the following effects of your choice:

items: Create a harmless, instantaneous sensory effect related to air, earth, fire, or water, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, a spray of light mist, or a gentle rumbling of stone.
Instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
Chill or warm up to 1 pound of nonliving material for up to 1 hour.
Cause earth, fire, water, or mist that can fit within a 1-foot cube to shape itself into a crude form you designate for 1 minute.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instant effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Elemental Blast
entries: A bolt of elemental energy descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d8} acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage, your choice.

The spell creates more than one bolt with the same damage type when you reach higher levels; two bolts at 5th level, three bolts at 11th level, and four bolts at 17th level. You can direct the bolts at the same target or at different ones. A target make one saving throw per bolt descending on it.

spell.name: Fire Flash

time.condition: that you take when you get attack by an enemy that can see you.

entries: A burst of bright light emanates from your body in response to being attacked. The attacker, must make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded, on a save it has disadvantage with attacks against you. Each creature in 10 feet from you, that can see you, must make a Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage with attacks against you as well. The effects last until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Elemental Mark
entries: You place an elemental mark on a creature that you can see within range. You choose acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder for the damage type of the spell. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the type chosen to the target whenever you hit it with an attack.
If you roll a 6 on the damage die of this spell, the creature suffers an additional effect depending on the damage type chosen:

items: {@b Acid:} One creature within 5 feet of the target takes acid damage equal to your spellcasting modifier.
{@b Cold:} The target has his speed reduced by 10 until the end of its next turn.
{@b Fire:} The targets radiate 10 feet bright light until the end of its next turn and the next attack against it has advantage.
{@b Lightning:} The target cannot take reactions until the end of its next turn.
{@b Thunder:} The target is pushed 10 ft. away from you.

entries: If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to move the mark to a new creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your concentration on the spell for up to 24 hours.

spell.name: Locate Elementals

components.m: a bit of dust and water, in pressence of a small fire

entries: Describe or name a specific kind of elemental creature. Concentrating on the voice of nature in your surroundings, you learn the direction and distance to the closest elemental creature of that kind within 5 miles, if any are present.

spell.name: Tornado

components.m: a feather of an owl or an eagle

entries: Choose a point you can see within the range to create a tornado. Winds howl in a 10-foot-radius and 20 ft. tall cylinder centered on that point. Each creature in the cylinder must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone, if the creature is large or smaller is pulled 5 feet away from the center of the cylinder, or half as much damage and not knocked prone or moved on a successful one
Any loose object object that weights no more than 100 pounds fly 10 feet away from the center.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Ice Tomb

components.m: a vial of water or ice made from a glacier

entries: You can burry one creature within the spell range in a tomb of ice. The creature must do a Constitution saving throw or get {@damage 6d8} cold damage and get petrified, on a successful save the creature get half damage and is not petrified. The creature can make a constitution saving throw to end this effect at the end of each of its turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Rejuvenation Shield

components.m: a pinch of mud and some seeds

entries: You make a barrier on a creature. Choose a creature that you can see within the spell range, and that creature gains {@dice 2d8} plus your Spellcasting modifier Temporary hit points.
When the target gets healed with a spell while the shield is up, it regains extra hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wind Step

time.condition: which you take when you do an attack

entries: You infuse yourself with a wind energy that let you have advantage to the attack and move one willingly ally in the reach of the target of your attack with a powerful wind 10 feet in one direction of your choosing.
Your ally movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from the target of your attack.

classFeature.name: Elemental Magic
entries: The Primordialist use her connection with elemental spirits to produce magic as elemental spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the Primordialist spell list. You learn additional Primordialist´s cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Primordialist table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: By 2nd level, you have learned to draw on elemental magic through meditation and communing with elemental spirits to cast spells as a druid does. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for the {@filter primordialist spell list|spells|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)}.

The Primordialist table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells. To cast one of your primordialist spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of primordialist spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the primordialist spell list. When you do so, choose a number of primordialist spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + half your primordialist level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level primordialist, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 14, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd-level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of primordialist spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your primordialist spells. The power of your spells comes from communing with elemental spirits. You use your Wisdom whenever a primordialist spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a primordialist spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Elemental Conjuration
entries: Any Primordialist's summon conjuration spell calls an elemental creature. This summons is elemental subtype instead of any choice the spells give. This doesn't change the base stats or abilities of the creature.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a Primordialist Focus (see the Player's Handbook chapter 5 for druid focus) as a spellcasting focus for your primordialist spells.

classFeature.name: Doctrine
entries: At 1st level, as a Primordialist you get a doctrine: or you become an Elemental Warrior or you become an Elemental Shaman. Your choice will grant you extra features at 3rd, 6th and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: Primordialist have affinity for one element. Choose one: Air, Earth, Fire or Water. This element will determinate some of the features a primordialist gains through levels. You learn the Primordial language and it gives the you these other abilities:
(You can find more Affinities if you clic on 'official sources' bottom unther the class table)

entries.name: Affinity Expanded Spells
entries: From 1st level, you gain access to an expanded spell list, the cantrips and affinity spells from your element are added to the primordialist spell list and are tagged with their element.
Also, at 2nd, 5th, 9th, 13th and 17th level you get an extra spell known with a spell tag matching your affinity element.
This spell must be from a level which you have spell slots.

entries.caption: Affinity Spells
rows: {@spell Dancing Lights}, {@spell Sacred Flame}, {@spell Word of Radiance|XGE}

entries.name: Void Affinity
entries: This affinity is a Special Affinity. At 1st, when you gain the Elemental Affinity Feature, you can choose to forget one of the 4 main elements: Air, Earth, Fire or Water.
When you do so you, you won't be able to access to the spells tagged with that element, calling options from that element and you won't be able to Choose that element as your Affinity Element.
Instead you gain access to spells tagged with the Void element, Void calling options and you can select Void as your Affinity Element.

entries.caption: Affinity Spells
rows: {@spell Eldritch Blast}, {@spell Prestidigitation}, {@spell Sword burst|tce} and {@spell Vicious Mockery},
{@spell Otiluke's Resilient Sphere} and {@spell Phantasmal Killer}

entries.name: Elemental Adaptation
entries: From 1st level, your affinity lets you adapt better to certain conditions:

entries.name: Air
entries: You are surrounded by a small breeze that keeps you dry and fresh all the time.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Your skin gets a thick and rough layer that make you look tougher and resilient, this makes you avoid one point of bleeding damage every round.

entries.name: Fire
entries: You feel warm in natural cold environments that are not magical or impossible to live.

entries.name: Water
entries: You are never thirsty if you have been in presence of water within a week.

entries.name: Void
entries: After you enter adulthood, your body appearance seems to stop ageing, although you still suffer all ageing effects as usual.

entries.name: Affinity Damage Types
entries: Some fo your abilities, when you gain levels in this class, depends on the types of damage that are associated to your affinity element.
The following list point out which type of damage is associated to a specific Affinity Element:

entries.name: Air
entries: Lightning or thunder damage.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Acid or bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Fire or radiant damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: Cold or piercing damage.

entries.name: Void
entries: You replace the forgotten Affinity Damage Type with these ones:
{@b Void:} Force or psychic damage.

classFeature.name: Callings
entries: Primordialist excel in call elemental spirits, the primordialist make a bond with elemental spirits to be called to aid him and his allies, or make his magic powerful.

entries.name: Callings
entries: You learn two callings of your choice, which are listed under "Callings" below. You learn additional callings as Shown in the calling known column in the primordialist table.
Each time you learn new calling, you can also replace one calling you know with a different one. Some callings have a class level prerequisite to be learned.

entries.name: Calling Uses
entries: You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a short or long rest. To use a calling, you must spend one use, you can activate more than one calling in a single round if the calling option allow you to.
You gain one more uses of this feature at 10th and 15th level.

entries.name: Saving Throws
entries: Some of your callings require your target to make a saving throw to resist the calling's effects. The saving throw DC is the same of your spell save DC.

entries.name: Concentration
entries: Some callings use concentration. These callings have a "conc." word inside the parenthesis, the duration is in the calling descriptions. Callings use the same rules for concentration on spells, as presented in chapter 10, "Spellcasting," of the Player's Handbook. Callings share concentration with spells, this means you can't concentrate on two callings abilities at the same time nor one spell and one calling.

entries.name: Clouding (conc.)
entries: As an action, you conjure clouds to create a solid and translucent simple structure like a ramp, a wall, a stair or so, which lasts for up to ten minutes in a point you can see within 60 feet of you. The structure can fill up to 10 times your wisdom modifier feet wide, high and length (minimum 10 ft.).

entries.name: Returning Wind
entries: When you get hit with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make an attack to that foe.

entries.name: Wind Step
entries: Once per turn, when you make an attack to a creature, you have advantage to the attack and one ally is moved with a powerful wind. Choose an ally who can see or hear you, she can use its reaction to make a Dash action. If you hit the creature with the attack, your ally doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from it with this movement.

entries.name: Ride the lightning
entries: As a bonus action, you teleport to an unoccupied space in up to 30 ft. from you that you can see. You create a 5 feet wide line of lightning between the start point and the end point of the teleportation damaging all creatures in it with 2d8 lightning damage on failed Dexterity saving throw or half the amount on a successful one.

entries.name: Flying Wind
entries: You gain fly speed for one minute equal to your land speed and you gain a 10 ft. bonus to all your types of movement.

entries.name: Teleporting Wind
entries: You can use the Teleport spell to teleport one willing creature to up to a number of miles equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum one). You can spend more calling uses to teleport more creatures, you teleport one extra creature por extra calling use you spend. A creature, can be target of this only once per long rest.

entries.name: Knock Back
entries: Once per round, when you hit with an attack you can knock the target. It must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked 10 feet away from you in a straight line. If it hits an object, this movement immediately ends and the target takes extra 2d6 bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock Shield
entries: As a bonus action, you make the skin of a creature hard as rock. Choose yourself or a creature in 60 feet of you that you can see, and that creature gains temporary hit points equal to your level plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum one). When the target gets healed with a spell while the shield is up, she regains extra hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

entries.name: Steel Shield
entries: When a creature other than you is attacked, you can place a steel shield as reaction giving +4 armor class to that creature for one round.

entries.name: Acid Wound
entries: As a reaction when you take piercing or slashing damage, you cause acid to spray from your wound; each creature within 5 feet of you takes 2d8 acid damage.

entries.name: Tremorsense (conc.)
entries: As a bonus action, you gain tremorsense with a radius of 30 feet, which lasts up to 10 minutes.

entries.name: Cold Iron Shield (conc.)
entries: As an action you gain resistance to spells. You have advantage on Saving Throws made against spells and spells effects for up to one minute.

entries.name: Burn Away (conc.)
entries: As a bonus action, choose up to three allies you can see within 60 feet of you. For up to one minute, each target has a 1d4 bonus to spell attacks and +1 bonus to Save DC.

entries.name: Flashlight
entries: As a reaction, when you get attacked, you can impose disadvantage on attacks rolls against you if you can see the attacker. If an attack still hits you, the attacker takes 1d8 radiant damage. The effect last until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Mindless Charge
entries: As a bonus action, choose up to your Wisdom modifier creatures you can see within 60 feet of you. Each target uses its reaction to move up to its speed in a straight line toward its nearest enemy. To avoid this effect the creature must make a charisma saving throw.

entries.name: Spear of Light
entries: As a bonus action, you create a floating spear of light in 60 ft. of you that lasts for one minute or until you use this ability again. When you create it, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the spear. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier radiant damage.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the spear up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.
As an action, you can toss the spear to an ally and heal his wounds. You heal the target for 2d8 hit points. After you toss the spear, it disappears.

entries.name: Aura of Bloodletting (conc.)
entries: As a bonus action, you unleash an aura of rage. For up to one minute, you and any creature within 30 feet of you has advantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Burst of Light
entries: When you do radiant damage to undead you can activate this calling. One of the affected undead must do a Constitution saving throw or takes 4d8 radiant damage or half as much in a successful one. If the undead is CR 3 or lower is destroyed instead on a failed save.

entries.name: Ice Sheet
entries: As an action, for one minute, you freeze the ground in a 10-foot radius centered on in a point on the ground you can see within 60 feet of you. It is difficult terrain, and any creature that moves more than 10 feet on it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. If the surface is sloped, a creature that falls prone in the area immediately slides to the bottom of the slope. You can have only one of this effect active at a time.

entries.name: Soothing Dew
entries: You can use an action to heal up to 3 creatures in 30 ft. of you. Each of them regains a number of hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier plus half your level.

entries.name: Water Barrier
entries: As a reaction, which you take when another creature than you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you give resistance to the triggering damage type to that creature.

entries.name: Energy Immunity (conc.)
entries: As an action, you can touch one creature and give it immunity to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice), for up to one minute.

entries.name: Spirit Link (conc.)
entries: As a bonus action, you radiate a spirit link with your allies for one minute. pick a number of willingly creatures within 60 feet of you equal to the spell level used, you linked their spirits making them distribute all damage taken.

If a creature it´s going to drop to 0 hit points hit point from the damage distribution, he takes damage until he is on one hit point, the rest of his damage is done to you and you lose the concentration after that damage is distributed.

entries.name: Deep Healing
entries: When you use a healing spell that role hit points, you can activate this calling. For one of the targets affected by the spell, you roll all of the spell´s healing dice twice and add them together, then apply any relevant modifier as normal, to calculate the amount you heal to that target.

entries.name: Void Calling Options
entries: You can choose to lose one of the four base element calling options: Air, Earth, Fire or Water. When you do so, you add the Void Calling Options to the list raplacing the forgotten ones.

entries.name: Void Weapon
entries: As a bonus action you can make your weapon cut the space, for the round your weapon gain 30 ft. reach and you ignore half and three quarters cover.

entries.name: Force Platform (conc.)
entries: As a bonus action you create a force platform in your feet for up to ten minutes. This platform can make you travel in any direction for up to 20 ft. per round as your movement.

entries.name: Pushing Force
entries: When you deal force damage with a spell, one target affected by the spell must make a Strength saving throw or you can push the target of 10 ft. in any direction you want.

entries.name: Spellsteal
entries: As an action you touch a creature and try to steal one spell of 1st or 2nd level. The target makes a Charisma saving throw, on a fail you can absorb the spell making it transfer to yourself.

At 10th level the spell can be up to a 4th level spell and a 20th level up to a 5th level spell. If you don't know if the target is under a spell effect, you can make an Intelligence (Arcana) check to a DC of 10 plus the spell level to see if it is under a spell of the level of which you can steal.
The DM can decide if he tells you what spell is affecting the target.

entries.name: Force Shield (conc.)
entries: You place in yourself a force shield, this shield will absorb damage for up to one minute. If the shield absorbs more than 5 times your level as damage, it will explodes ending the effect, creatures in 20 feet from the explosion must succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw or get 4d8 force damage or half much on a successful save.

entries.name: Astral Shifting
entries: As a reaction when you are going to take damage you can shift part of yourself to the astral plane for a brief time making you take half damage from the triggering effect. If the effect requires a saving throw, you take no damage if you succeed on the save.

classFeature.name: Elemental Power
entries: When the primordialsit active a calling, she can store some elemental power for up to one minute. Also, she can spend one calling use to store power. When she is going to roll damage with a weapon or a cantrip while she is storing elemental power, she can decide to release it to get a 1d8 bonus to the damage. At 8th level this damage increase to 2d8.
The primordialist can have only one elemental power stored at a time.

The type of damage depends on her affinity element damage type. If the power was stored from a calling, the type of damage depends on the calling element. Pick one of the two affinity damage type to store.

classFeature.name: Doctrine feature
entries: At 3rd level, you gain another feature from your Doctrine.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Doctrine feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain another feature from your Doctrine.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Elemental Resistance
entries: At 10th level you gain resistance to one kind of elemental damage, pick one from the two of your Affinity Damage Type.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Doctrine feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain another feature from your Doctrine.

classFeature.name: Elemental Form
entries: At 15th level, add the {@spell Polymorph}  spell to your spell list. If you use the spell on yourself, you can transform into any elemental creatures, but this elemental creature must have a CR of up to half your level. You can cast it on yourself without spending spell slots, and without need to concentrate on the spell once per long rest.
Also, you get a characteristic ability from your affinity element:

entries.name: Air
entries: You gain fly speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Earth
entries: You gain the earth glide monster feature.

entries.name: Fire
entries: When you get hit or hit a creature in melee range you may choose to do an extra 1d10 fire damage to that creature.

entries.name: Water
entries: You gain swim speed equal to your walking speed and you can breathe underwater.

entries.name: Void
entries: Once per turn when you take a dash action you can Teleport up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Elemental Body
entries: Starting at 18th level, the primordial magic that you wield causes you to age more slowly. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year. Also, you don´t need to sleep nor eat or drink more than once per week, and you are not affected by magic that makes you sleep.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Elementalism
entries: From 20th level, if you roll the maximum number on any of the dice (a 6 with a d6, a 10 with a d10, etc.) when you do damage of the type of your Affinity Damage Type, you get to re-roll again and add the additional roll to your total for that damage roll.

classFeature.name: Primal Transformation (1/rest)
entries: At 1st level, you learn how to assume a form of primal power to enhance your abilities.

As a bonus action you can transform yourself for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated. At your option, you also gain minor physical attributes that are reminiscent of your transformation, for example, if you learn the Storm´s Hurricane transformation your eyes can change color to a blue lightning color or you can have some sparking energy cracking around you and so.
When you get this feature you learn one of the following transformations.

entries.name: Form of Storm's Hurricane.
entries: You assume the guardian form of the Storm's Hurricane. While you are in this form, you gain 10 feet bonus to your movement speed. Also, weapon attacks and spells you made deal extra lightning damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Form of the Flametongue.
entries: You assume the guardian form of the Flametongue. While you are in this form, any enemy that starts its turn adjacent to you takes fire damage equal to your Wisdom modifier. Also, spells you made deal extra lightning damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Form of Stone Herald.
entries: You assume the guardian form of the Stone Herald. You gain a +1 bonus to AC and advantage to strength (athletics) checks. Also, when you enter this form you get an earth shield granting temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier plus your level.

entries.name: Form of Waterflow.
entries: You gain swim speed equal to your walking speed and you can breathe under water. Also, as a bonus action, you can touch a creature other than yourself, and grant it your Wisdom modifier as temporary hit points.
You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Font of Life
entries: At 2nd level, you learn how to gain some of the nature's resiliance. At the start of the Warden turn, she can reroll a saving throw against any one ongoing effect with advantage, such as a {@spell hold person} spell. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends before the warden suffers any effects.
You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By 2nd level, the Warden use her connection with primal spirits to produce magic as spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for the {@filter warden spell list|spells|class=Warden (Zorindis)}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 2nd level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the warden spell list. You learn additional warden cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Warden table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Warden table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells. To cast one of your warden spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of warden spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the warden spell list. When you do so, choose a number of warden spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + half your warden level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 5th-level warden, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 14, your list of prepared spells can include four spells of 1st or 2nd-level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of warden spells requires time spent in commining and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your warden spells, sicne the power of your spells comes from communing with elemental spirits. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warden spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a druid focus (found in chapter 5) as a spellcasting focus for your warden spells.

classFeature.name: Mark of the Nature's Wrath
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the ability to impose the wrath oft he nature on your enemies. When you damage an enemy with an attack or a cantrip spell, you can mark the creatures you affect until the end of your next turn. This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or you die.

Once on each of your turns when you hit a marked creature with a weapon attack, you can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d6 bonus damage as acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage, your choice.

entries.name: Unleashed Wrath
entries: When a marked creature attacks another creature other than yourself, you can use your reaction to gain advantage in the first attack you made until the end of your next turn to that creature.
You can use the Unleashed Wrath a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Primal Calling
entries: At 3rd level, you choose one aspect of primal calling you feel an affinity from.
Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level. Those features include Primal Calling spells.

entries.name: Primar Calling Spells
entries: Each guardian calling has a list of associated spells. You gain access to these spells at the levels specified in the Primal Calling description. Once you gain access to a Primal Calling spell, you always have it prepared. Primal Calling spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.
If you gain a Primal Calling spell that doesn't appear on the Warden spell list, the spell is nonetheless a warden spell for you.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Primal Weapon
entries: From 5th level, when you use the {@action Attack} Action, you can use your bonus action to cast cantrip spell that has a casting time of one action.
If you have the Extra Attack feature, you can do only one attack with your attack action when using this feature.

classFeature.name: Primal Transformation Improvement (2/rest)
entries: At 6th level, you learn one extra Primal Transformation. Also, you can transform one extra time between rest. Although you can only use one transformations at the at time. You can spend one of the uses to change to another transformation.

classFeature.name: Primal Calling feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Primal Calling.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Primal Elemental Transformation.
entries: From 10th level, when you use your primal transformation, you get the benefits of the following investiture spells for the duration of the transformation, although you don't need concentration to maintain these benefits.

entries.name: Form of Storm's Hurricane.
entries: {@spell Investiture of Wind|XGE}

entries.name: Form of the Flametongue.
entries: {@spell Investiture of Flame|XGE}

entries.name: Form of Stone Herald.
entries: {@spell Investiture of Stone|XGE}

entries.name: Form of Waterflow.
entries: {@spell Investiture of Ice|XGE}

classFeature.name: Primal Calling feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Primal Calling.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Primal Weapon Improvement
entries: From 14th Level, your primordial weapon works with any spell with a casting time of one action.
You can use this feature to control an ongoing damaging spell as the {@spell call lightning} spell that requires an action to control instead of casting a new spell.

classFeature.name: Primal Calling feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Primal Calling.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Primal Transformation Improvement (3/rest)
entries: At 18th level, you learn one extra Primal Transformation. Also, you can transform one extra time between rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: True Nature's Wrath
entries: At 20th level, the Mark of the Nature's Wrath became more powerful.
You can place you mark with any spell that deals damage.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Warrior
entries: An Elemental Warrior is a Primordialist that know how to mix elemental magic with martial training

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Warrior's Proficiency
entries: When you choose this doctrine at 1st level, you gain proficiency with Martial Weapons.
Your hit point increases by 1 per level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Weapons
entries: From 1st level you learn how to deliver your spells from your weapons. As an action you make a bond with one weapon making it your spellcasting focus, while you are holding it you can use an attack action to cast damaging spells with it.

You cast your spells using the ability modifier of your bonded weapon as the spellcasting ability. You apply the weapon ability and bonus modifier to the spell damage, and the range of the weapon instead the spell range; the dice and type of damage, and extra effects are dictated by the spell.
Range and melee attacks rules apply, even for actions as the grapple or shove actions if the spell gives you more than one attack.
Most damage cantrips get better when you reach a certain character level. When you use this ability, your class level is the one which determinate the improvements on those cantrips.
You can have this bond with one weapon at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Shroud
entries: From 3rd level, the elemental warrior is shroud himself with some elemental energy letting you take advantage in combat depending on his affinity element:

entries.name: Air
entries: As a bonus action the elemental warrior can use the Dash or Disengage action.

entries.name: Earth
entries: As a bonus action you can pick one enemy of your choice, you gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from that enemy.

entries.name: Fire
entries: You engulf yourself in fire, you can use your bonus action to deal 1d8 fire damage to any creatures you choose in 5 ft. of you on a failed Dexterity saving throw or half that much in a successful one.

entries.name: Water
entries: When you do cold damage with a spell, one creature affected by the spell has his movement speeds reduced to half on a failed Constitution save, until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Void
entries: You have a force field around you granting you an unarmored force armor of 13 plus your Dexterity modifier. You can use shields and still benefits from this.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Unleash
entries: From 6th level, you learn to unleash your elemental power to boost your combat capabilities even further. When you use a calling with the same element as your Affinity you can gain the following bonus for one minute, then you must finish a short or long rest to use this ability again:

entries.name: Air
entries: You augment your weapons with air by sharpening them. Weapons you hold have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. At 10th level this bonus increases by 1 and again at 15th level.

entries.name: Earth
entries: You blend yourself with the ground, this reduce your movement by half while blended. When you are blend to the ground you cannot be knocked prone and enemies moving in your melee reach provokes attacks of opportunity from you. Un-blend yourself is a bonus action. You lose this bonus while you stop touching ground.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Weapons you hold emanates sunlight while you wield them. You radiate bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet, and any undead in the bright light have disadvantage on attacks rolls and dexterity saving throws. Also, your elemental shroud deals an additional 1d8 as radiant damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: When you are healed by a spell you regain 2 extra hit points per spell slot used.

entries.name: Void
entries: You can reflect damage. As a Reaction, when you receive damage you can deal half the damage you suffered to the source of it.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Battery
entries: From 14th level, you can charge an elemental battery with your attacks. Once per round, when you manage to hit a hostile enemy with an attack, you can charge your elemental battery.

You can have up to 3 charges. Once you have three charges, instead of charge your battery in that round, you can discharge all three charges to change the casting time of one spell from an action to a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Shaman
entries: An Elemental Shaman is a Primordialist dedicated in raw elemental magic. Your reservoir of Spell Known, Cantrips Known and Spell Slots is higher.
Use the Elemental Shaman table for Spell Slot per Spell Level, and for Cantrips and Spell known.

subclassFeature.name: Ritual Caster
entries: From 1st level you can cast any primordialist spell you know as ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

subclassFeature.name: Damage Adaptability
entries: From 1st level, you can change the type of damage of one spell you cast that dealt  {@filter Acid|spells|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=acid}, {@filter Cold|spells|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=cold},  {@filter Fire|spells|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=fire},  {@filter Lightning|spells|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=lightning},  {@filter Radiant|spells|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=radiant} or  {@filter Thunder|spells|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=thunder} damage to another type of that list.
You must finish a short or long rest to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Void Damage Adaptability
entries: If you selected the Void Affinity as your affinity add  {@filter Force|spells|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=force} and  {@filter psychic|spells|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=psychic} damage to the list

subclassFeature.name: Calling Master
entries: At 3rd level you gain an extra calling. This calling must be from the same element of your Elemental Affinity.
If you want to change this calling when you get a level in this class, the new calling must match your affinity element as well.

subclassFeature.name: Fulmination
entries: From 6th level, you boost your cantrip depending on your affinity element. You add your wisdom modifier to the damage of the following:

entries.name: Air
entries: {@filter Lightning|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=lightning} and {@filter thunder|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=thunder} damage cantrips.

entries.name: Earth
entries: {@filter Acid|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=acid} and {@filter bludgeoning|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=bludgeoning} damage cantrips.

entries.name: Fire
entries: {@filter Fire|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=fire} and {@filter radiant|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=radiant} damage cantrips.

entries.name: Water
entries: {@filter Cold|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=cold} and {@filter necrotic|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=necrotic} damage cantrips.

entries.name: Void Fulmination
entries: If you choose the Void Elemental Affinity, you use these types of damage
{@b Void:} {@filter Force|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=force} or {@filter psychic|spells|level=0|class=Primordialist (Zorindis)|damage type=psychic}  cantrip damage

subclassFeature.name: Shamanism
entries: From 14th level, your Elemental Power bonus damage now apply to every of your damaging spell.

subclassFeature.name: General Spell Tags
entries: These are the General Spells tags.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Elemental Attunement and Elemental Blast.

entries.name: 1st-level
entries: Absorb Elements, Chaos Bolt, Chromatic Orb, Detect Evil and Good, Detect Magic, Elemental Mark, Find Familiar and Wild Cunning.

entries.name: 2nd-level
entries: Dragon Breath and Enhance Ability.

entries.name: 3rd-level
entries: Conjure Animals, Dispel Magic, Elemental Weapon, Magic Circle and Protection from Energy.

entries.name: 4th-level
entries: Banishment, Conjure Minor Elementals and Elemental Bane.

entries.name: 5th-level
entries: Commune with Nature, Conjure Elemental, Contact Other Plane, Dispel Evil and Good, Planar Binding and Reincarnate.

entries.name: 6th-level
entries: Planar Ally and Primordial Ward.

entries.name: 7th-level
entries: Plane Shift.

entries.name: 9th-level
entries: Gate and True Resurrection.

subclassFeature.name: Void Spell Element Tags
entries: These are the Spells tags for Void spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Barrack´s Bashing Shield, Mage Hand.

entries.name: 1st-level
entries: Alarm, Sleep, Tenser's Floating Disk and Unseen Servant.

entries.name: 2nd-level
entries: Arcane Lock, Earthbind, Hold Person, Locate Objects and See Invisibility.

entries.name: 3rd-level
entries: Blink, Clairvoyance and Leomund's Tiny Hut.

entries.name: 4th-level
entries: Locate Creature and Dimension Door.

entries.name: 5th-level
entries: Animate Objects, Antilife Shell, Circle of Power, Hold Monster, Rary's Telepathic Bond, Scrying and Wall of Force.

entries.name: 6th-level
entries: Disintegrate, Globe of invulnerability and True Seeing.

entries.name: 7th-level
entries: Etherealness, Forcecage and Reverse Gravity.

entries.name: 8th-level
entries: Antimagic Field and Maze.

entries.name: 9th-level
entries: Invulnerability and Timestop.

subclassFeature.name: Air Spell Element Tags
entries: These are the Spells tags for Air spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Booming Blade, Gust, Lightning Lure, Shocking Grasp and Thunderclap.

entries.name: 1st-level
entries: Feather Fall, Fog Cloud, Jump, Thunderwave and Zephyr Strike.

entries.name: 2nd-level
entries: Gust of Wind, Levitate, Mirror Image, Shatter, Skywrite, Tornado and Warding Wind.

entries.name: 3rd-level
entries: Call Lightning, Fly, Haste, Lightning Arrow, Sending, Thunder Step and Wind Wall.

entries.name: 4th-level
entries: Dimension Door, Freedom of Movement and Storm Sphere.

entries.name: 5th-level
entries: Control Winds, Destructive Wave, Steel Wind Strike and Teleportation Circle.

entries.name: 6th-level
entries: Chain Lightning, Investiture of Wind, Scatter and Wind Walk.

entries.name: 7th-level
entries: Teleport and Whirlwind.

entries.name: 8th-level
entries: Control Weather.

entries.name: 9th-level
entries: Storm of Vengeance.

subclassFeature.name: Earth Spell Element Tags
entries: These are the Spells tags for Earth spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Acid Splash, Barrack´s Bashing Shield, Magic Stone, Mending and Mold Earth

entries.name: 1st-level
entries: Catapult and Earth Tremor.

entries.name: 2nd-level
entries: Dust Devil, Earthbind, Maximilian's Earthen Grasp and Pass Without Trace.

entries.name: 3rd-level
entries: Meld into Stone, Melf's Minute Meteors, Slow and Wall of Sand.

entries.name: 4th-level
entries: Stone Shape, Stoneskin and Vitriolic Sphere.

entries.name: 5th-level
entries: Passwall, Transmute Rock and Wall of Stone.

entries.name: 6th-level
entries: Bones of the Earth, Investiture of Stone and Move Earth.

entries.name: 7th-level
entries: Reverse Gravity.

entries.name: 8th-level
entries: Earthquake.

entries.name: 9th-level
entries: Imprisonment.

subclassFeature.name: Fire Spell Element Tags
entries: These are the Spells tags for Fire spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Control Flames, Fire Bolt, Green-Flame Blade, Light and Produce Flame.

entries.name: 1st-level
entries: Burning Hands and Faery Fire.

entries.name: 2nd-level
entries: Aganazzar's Scorcher, Darkvision, Flame Blade, Heat Metal and Scorching Ray.

entries.name: 3rd-level
entries: Daylight, Fireball and Flame Arrows.

entries.name: 4th-level
entries: Fire Shield and Wall of Fire.

entries.name: 5th-level
entries: Flame Strike, Immolation and Wall of Light.

entries.name: 6th-level
entries: Disintegrate, Investiture of Flame and Sunbeam.

entries.name: 7th-level
entries: Crown of Stars, Delayed Blast Fireball and Fire Storm.

entries.name: 8th-level
entries: Sunburst.

entries.name: 9th-level
entries: Meteor Swarm.

subclassFeature.name: Water Spell Element Tags
entries: These are the Spells tags for Water spells.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Frostbite, Ray of Frost and Shape Water.

entries.name: 1st-level
entries: Armor of Agathys, Create or Destroy Water, Cure Wounds, Healing Word, Ice Knife and Purify Food and Drink.

entries.name: 2nd-level
entries: Healing Spirit, Lesser Restoration, Misty Step and Snilloc's Snowball Swarm.

entries.name: 3rd-level
entries: Sleet Storm, Tidal Wave, Wall of Water, Water Breathing and Water Walk.

entries.name: 4th-level
entries: Control Water, Ice Storm and Watery Sphere.

entries.name: 5th-level
entries: Cone of Cold, Greater Restoration, Maelstrom and Mass Cure Wounds.

entries.name: 6th-level
entries: Investiture of Ice, Otiluke's Freezing Sphere and Wall of Ice.

entries.name: 7th-level
entries: Regenerate.

entries.name: 8th-level
entries: Abi-Dalzim's Horrid Wilting and Tsunami.

entries.name: 9th-level
entries: Mass Heal.

entries.name: Primal Calling Spells
entries: You gain primal calling spells at the Warden level listed

entries.name: Storm Lightning Arc
entries: From 3rd Level, when you cast a spell that deals thunder or lightning damage, you can send a sparking thundering energy to all marked enemies dealing an extra damage equal to your Wisdom modifier plus half your level.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Embrace
entries: From 7th level, you gain resistance to Thunder and Lightning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Shift
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to shift as a lightning in a storm. When you spend a 1st or higher spell slot level to use a spell that deals thunder or lightning damage, before or after the spell effect is done, you can teleport yourself to an unoccupied space within the spell range to up to your movement speed.

subclassFeature.name: Flaying wind
entries: From 15th level, you gain Fly speed equal to your land speed.

entries.name: Primal Calling Spells
entries: You gain primal calling spells at the Warden level listed

entries.name: Sun's Flame
entries: When you choose this Primal Calling at 3rd level, if you know the {@spell Elemental Blast|Zorindis} cantrip the spell can deal radiant damage as well.
Your extra damage from your Mark of the Nature's Wrath can deal radiant damage as well.

entries.name: Guiding Light
entries: From 3rd Level, when you cast a spell that deals fire or radiant damage, you can briefly guide your allies attacks against the marked enemies. Attacks made to the marked creatures have advantage until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Flame Embrace
entries: From 7th level, you gain resistance to Fire and Radiant damage.

subclassFeature.name: Light Spirit
entries: From 11th level, you gain Darkvision of 60 feet, if you already have darkvision the range increase in 60 feet. Also, you can use your bonus action to emit sunlight within 30 ft. of you, you can put if off whenever you want, no action needed.

subclassFeature.name: Sunburn
entries: From 15th level, your spells inflict a sunburn to your enemies. Enemies that fail a saving throw or are hit with one spell attack from a 1st level or higher spells you cast, that deals fire or radiant damage, start to burn taking 1d6 of the spell damage for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier.

Those enemies can use an action to make a Constitution saving throw to resist the sunburn versus your spell DC, on a success the sunburn end. An enemy can have only one sunburn effect on itself at the same time.

entries.name: Primal Calling Spells
entries: You gain primal calling spells at the Warden level listed

entries.name: Shake te Earth
entries: From 3rd Level, when you cast a spell that deals bludgeoning damage, you can put prone every creature at 10 feet from you. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone, marked enemies have disadvantage on the save.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sunder Armor
entries: From 7th level, enemies you mark with your Mark of the Nature's Wrath, have minus 1 to their Armor Class.

subclassFeature.name: Earthglide
entries: From 11th level, you gain burrow speed equal to your movement speed and you can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, you don't disturb the material you moves through.

subclassFeature.name: Earthquake
entries: From 15th level, you learn how to make the earth really shake. You can cast the {@spell Earthquake} spell. You can use this once, you must finish a long rest to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Primordial
entries: All raw power pf elements in creation and destruction made balance letting creatures to sprout, rise and live. Primordial Circle druids are masters of these elements and they use the power of them to preserve the balance that keep this world such alive and beautiful, even if they have to use their destructive or healing powers to do so.

Members of the Primordial Circle gain their powers through knowledge and experiences with elements, they can achieve this by communing with intelligent elemental creatures, studying great elemental events on the nature or even live in planes with high elemental influence.

entries.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: At 2nd level, the Primordialist have affinity for one element. Choose one: Air, Earth, Fire or Water. This element will determinate some of the features you gain through levels. Also, you learn the Primordial language.

entries.name: Bonus Cantrip
entries: At 2nd level, you learn one cantrip from your affinity element:

entries.name: Air
entries: {@spell Booming blade|tce}, {@spell Lightning lure|tce} or {@spell Shocking Grasp}

entries.name: Earth
entries: {@spell Acid Splash}, {@spell Mage Hand} or {@spell Poison Spray}

entries.name: Fire
entries: {@spell Fire Bolt}, {@spell Green-flame blade|tce} or {@spell Sacred Flame}

entries.name: Water
entries: {@spell Chill Touch}, {@spell Ray of Frost} or {@spell Virtue (UA)|UAStarterSpells}

entries.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your connection with elementals infuses you with the access to certain spells. You gain the {@spell Chromatic Orb} spell and when you reach 3rd, 5th, 7th and 9th level, you gain 2 spells which you can choose form your affinity element or the universal spell lists bellow, once you gain access to a circle spell, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day.
If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

entries.caption: Circle Spells
rows: {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} and {@spell Maximilian's Earthen Grasp|XGE}
{@spell Misty Step} and {@spell Snilloc's Snowball Swarm|XGE}
{@spell Dragon's Breath|XGE} and {@spell Locate Elementals|Zorindis Campain Setting}
{@spell Erupting Earth|XGE} and {@spell Wall of Sand|XGE}
{@spell Tidal Wave|XGE} and {@spell Wall of Water|XGE}
{@spell Otiluke's Resilient Sphere} and {@spell Stone Shape}
{@spell Destructive Wave} and {@spell Steel Wind Strike|XGE}
{@spell Contact Other Plane} and {@spell Teleportation Circle}

entries.name: Elemental Form
entries: Your connection with elements lets you transform into them.
From 2nd level, you can use your wild shape, as a bonus action, to transform yourself into elemental creatures. If the creature has spells, you can cast them as the creature can.
You can choose to spend two uses of your wild shape to do it with elemental creatures that have a challenge rating as high as your druid level divided by 3, rounded down.

entries.name: Callings
entries: From 2nd level, you learn to call elemental spirits to aid you in combat. There are two ways in how they can help you: adapting the elemental nature of your spells or through letting you shape your spells to deliver them with a weapon you are holding.
Pick one from Damage Adaptability or Primordial Weapon:

entries.name: Damage Adaptability
entries: When you cast a spell with a type of damage different from the types of your affinity element, you can change it to match it with one from your affinity element. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest. You can see the types of damage associated to your affinity element in the following list:

items.name: Air
entries: Lightning and thunder damage.

items.name: Earth
entries: Acid and poison damage.

items.name: Fire
entries: Fire and radiant damage.

items.name: Water
entries: Cold and necrotic damage.
At 6th level, you boost your spells. You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage of the spells that deals the type of damage from your affinity.

entries.name: Primordial Weapon
entries: You can use a bonus action to make a bond with one weapon making it your druid focus for one minute, while you are holding it you have the following benefits:

items: You can cast damaging spells using the ability modifier of your bonded weapon as your spellcasting ability.

You can use the weapon range instead of the spell range for the spells, and when you do so, you apply any bonus the weapon give to attack and/or damage to your spells cast through the weapon. Spells attacks made this way are considered weapon attacks as well.
For spells that grant more than one attack, you can replace one of them to use actions that replace one weapon attack as the grapple or shove actions.

entries: You can have this bond with one weapon at a time. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Quintessence
entries: Your connection with elements teaches you deeper ways to bond with them. At 6th level, you learn one of the following quintessences:

entries.name: Elemental Shroud
entries: Depending on your Affinity element you learn one of the following abilities:

items.name: Air
entries: You can use your bonus action to use the dash or disengage actions, or make one weapon attack.

items.name: Earth
entries: As a bonus action you can pick one enemy of your choice, you gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from that enemy for one round.

items.name: Fire
entries: As a bonus action you can produce an aura of light around you providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet for one minute. While the aura is active, if an enemy inside the bright light of the aura hit you with an attack you can use your reaction to deal 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier as fire damage to the attacker.

items.name: Water
entries: When you hit with a spell attack or a creature fails a saving throw against a spell you cast, and that spell deals cold damage, you can use your bonus action to reduce the movement of one creature affected by your spell, by 10 feet for one round.

entries.name: Elemental Power
entries: You learn how to improve your elemental damage. You have a pool of energy represented by a number of d6s equal to your druid level.

When you roll damage for a spell, you can increase that damage by spending dice from the pool. You can spend a number of dice equal to half your druid level or less. Roll the spent dice and add them to the damage.
You regain the expended dice when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Elemental Summoner
entries: Creatures you conjure are more resilient than normal. Any creature summoned or created by a spell that you cast gains the following benefits:

items: The creature appears with more hit points than normal: 2 extra hit points per Hit Die it has.
The damage from its natural weapons deals an extra 1d4 acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder damage, your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Body
entries: From 10th level your body resemble more to an elemental creature. You don´t need to sleep nor eat or drink more than once per week, and you are not affected by magic that makes you sleep.
Also, depending on your elemental affinity you gain resistance to these types of damage:

entries.name: Air
entries: Lightning and thunder damage.

entries.name: Earth
entries: Acid and poison damage.

entries.name: Fire
entries: Fire and radiant damage.

entries.name: Water
entries: Cold and necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Lord
entries: At 14th level, you add the universal and your affinity element spells from the following list to the druid's spell list:

entries.name: Air
entries: {@spell Chain Lightning} and {@spell Teleport} spells.

entries.name: Earth
entries: {@spell Globe of Invulnerability} and {@spell Maze} spells

entries.name: Fire
entries: {@spell Delayed Blast Fireball} and {@spell Incendiary Cloud} spells

entries.name: Water
entries: {@spell Abi-Dalzim's Horrid Wilting|XGE} and {@spell Wall of Ice} spells.

entries.name: Universal
entries: {@spell Demiplane} and {@spell True Polymorph} spells

Nature is the ruler of the life, the omnipresent state of the living. Before creatures, all that be in this world were elements combining and existing together, modeling the world all things lives in, the material plane. All that raw power of creation and destruction made balance letting creatures to sprout, rise and live. Primordialist are masters of this primordial elements and they tend to preserve the balance that keep this world such alive and beautiful even if they have to use their destructive or healing powers to do so.

Primordialist gain their powers through knowledge and experiences with elements, they can achieve this by making pacts with intelligent elemental creatures, studying great elemental events on the nature or even live in planes with high elemental influence.

entries.name: The Guide
entries: Primordialist have an important role in helping a group, sometimes right through their skills in combat and elemental damage, sometimes to keep the group alive through defending or healing them. Yet we cannot forget their callings that benefit the group in some mysterious ways.

Primordialist´s role is very similar to druid´s. Elements are natural, as is necessary to protect the plants and animals is well needed to protect the balance of air, earth, fire and water that allows the ecosystem remain standing

entries.name: Creating a Primordialist
entries: When making a primordialist, the most important think should be how you get your approach to elemental spirits. This could happen by many ways. Perhaps you born in a community with an adoration to spirits or elements, you could have born from an elemental creature or have linage of it or born in another plane with high elemental influence.

Maybe you have a special contact with an elemental creature that give you part of his soul or teach you the way to commune with them. One of the most important things is that you get special training with raw primordial magic, an ancient magic served by the interaction with elemental spirits in the nature.

entries.name: Quick build.
entries: You can make a Primordialist quickly by following this suggestion. First, Wisdom should be your highest ability score, following by Strength/Dexterity if you want to use weapons, if not, Constitution is a good choice. Second, choose the hermit background. Then, the Fire Affinity and the Elemental Shaman doctrine.
